content: this is a summary of a legal case in slovenia the supreme court made a decision on january 31 2019 regarding a case involving two parties the specific details of the case are not provided but it can be inferred that the court made a decision regarding the costs involved in the first instance the judgment was in favor of the plaintiff and the defendant was ordered to bear the costs the case was then taken to the supreme court but no further information is provided about the outcome the final resolution of the case involves a judgment on the division of two real estate properties a dwelling house and a stable the court has confirmed that the properties will be divided equally with each party receiving a 50 share the supreme court has granted permission to review the case and has sent it back to the lower court for further proceedings the court made a decision based on several sections of the marriage family relations act the court stated that if a defendant believes their share of coowned property is greater than half they can file a counterclaim to defend their rights in this case the defendants land which was initially separate property became coowned property with the plaintiff however the defendants substantial contribution to the acquisition of the coowned property may impact the determination of a greater share in favor of the defendant the judgment of the court has been revised and set aside by the court of first instance and the case will be sent back for a new trial the decision on costs will be reserved for the final decision

metadata.CASE_ID: Sodba Vrhovnega sodišča RS II Ips 128/2017, 31. 1. 2019
